data.title: Catherine Hickland Spouse, Children, Net Worth, Age, Bio, Facts
data.meta_description: Singer, author, entrepreneur, film, stage and television actress; These are the various titles that come with the name Catherine Hickland. This
data.text:
Singer, author, entrepreneur, film, stage and television actress; These are the various titles that come with the name Catherine Hickland. This multi-talented personality has been on television since 1978, making guest appearances on a few television series. That was until she got her breakthrough with a recurring role on the 1980s TV series Texas, which she starred in from 1980 to 1981.

She then bolstered her portfolio with films like The Last Married Couple in America (1980), Witchcraft (1988) , and Dead City (1988). For her stage performances, she portrayed the character Fantine in a production of the French Broadway historical novel Les Misérables first published in 1862. She also participated as the character Lindsay Rappaport on Une vie à vivre, a 1998 American soap opera. to 2012, making it his longest appearance in a single Broadway television series or play.

In 2001, Catherine Hikckland added the prestigious role of CEO to her name. She launched her own line of cosmetics, which she named Cat Cosmetics.

Catherine Hickland’s Bio and Age

The actress was born to Arthur and Mary Hickland on February 11, 1956 in Faut Lauderdale, Florida. Catherine’s mother, Mary, worked as a dental ceramist, while her father, Arthur, was a dentist. She grew up with two siblings; a brother and a sister. Catherine received her secondary education at Fort Lauderdale High School. After graduating in 1974, she continued her studies at Florida Atlantic University, but her stay at this university did not last. After two years, she left school in favor of a flight attendant for the then national airline. Six months after taking office, she participated in the filming of an advertisement for the airline. It was there that she realized the potential she had to act.

After trying out for several daytime dramas, she finally got her start in the big leagues with her role in Texas. Here she played the role of Dr. Courtney Marshall from 1980 to 1981. Three years later, she was Julie Clegg McCandless in the CBS opera. Capitol, a role she played from 1984 to 1987. Between 1985 and 1986, she also had a dual role on the show as a character known as Jenny Diamond.

From 1983 to 1986, she was Stephanie “Stevie” Mason on the NBC series, Knight Rider. However, these three years of the show have seen her appear in just three episodes. This was likely due in part to the fact that she had been linked with a host of other film roles around this time. Catherine Hickland was also on the game show The Language of the Body, for 15 episodes in 1985.

In 1987, she starred as Brooke Logan in two episodes of Love, Fame and Beauty, standing in for Katherine Kelly Lang who was sick at the time. In the 90s, Catherine Hickland starred in many films and television series. She was Tess Wilder in Magnet from 1993 to 1995, and The Town from 1995 to 1997. She went on to make guest appearances in TV series like Chips (1983), Law & Order (2001), and Law & Order . : criminal intent (2005).

Catherine, who had already started singing in the 1980s, performed in Lyon, France with the Lyon National Symphony in 1995. A few years later, in 2001, she released her first CD, Cordialement Broadway while working for start his own business. She founded Cat Cosmetics in 2001, where she assumed the role of CEO. She also once contributed to Soap Opera Digest’s cosmetics and skincare column.

Catherine Hickland’s first work as an author was published in December 2008. It was titled: The 30-Day Heartbreak Treatment – ​​A Guide to Getting Over It and Reaching It in a Month. She followed that exactly six years later with her second: God’s Excellent Adventure at Cat & Fern: Daily Inspirations from 365 Days of Heaven on Earth, which she co-wrote with Lindsay Harrison and Fern Underwood. She added the hypnotist to her portfolio since 2008 and has maintained it ever since.

His wife and children

Hickland has been married more than once. Her first marriage has the makings of an enviable love affair. She met her first husband, Richard Knowlton, when they were both in high school. They fell in love and got married a few years later, either in 1978 or 1981, according to different sources. However, their romance was short-lived as they got divorced just three months into the marriage.

She then married famous singer and producer, David Hasselhoff on March 24, 1984. The marriage lasted five years and ended on March 1, 1989. Catherine then moved on to actor Michael E. Knight on June 27, 1992. It was about of his longest marriage; the couple remained in New York until their divorce in 2006.

Her fourth marriage was to fellow actor cumproducer: Todd Fisher. The couple married on Christmas Day 2012. They live in Las Vegas, California, where they also own a ranch. Whether through a series of unfortunate circumstances or by mutual agreement, none of Catherine’s marriages had any children.

Net value

The actress isn’t doing badly on the asset side of things. Over the years, she’s made money from different things: starring roles and appearances in movies and TV series, and earnings from her cosmetics line. Some would even say that she may also have killed three divorce cases, including two from prominent figures. Celebrity Net Worth places his net worth at $20 million.

Facts About Catherine Hickland

Catherine has worked with David Hasselhoff on set and in the studio

While Catherine was engaged to the famous Hasselhoff, the lovebirds worked together in the television series Chevalier Cavalier. Her character was also engaged to Micheal Knight, Hasselhoff’s character. Hickland sang a few songs on Hasselhoff’s debut album Night Rocker. Hickland provided vocals on the songs Our First Night Together, and Let It Be Me.

Hickland is a hypnotist

Yes, that is correct. Hickland is a practicing hypnotist. For some reason, she decided to add this stock to her already huge portfolio, making it her most active stock alongside CEO since 2008.

Catherine is married into a famous family

Hickland’s marriage to Todd Fisher in 2012 paired her with yet another famous face in the industry. However, it also landed him a few famous relationships. Todd Fisher is a brother of famous actress Carrie Fisher. The popular actress has starred in popular TV series like Sex and the City, and Smallville. Her most memorable role came as Princess Leia in the Star Wars franchise. The actress passed away on December 27, 2016. Carrie Fisher’s mother was even more iconic actress Debbie Reynolds, who tragically died a day after Carrie on December 28, 2016.
